conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a cutaway 3D model: walls have height and thickness, multiple wall faces are visible, interiors read as volumes, and the camera is elevated/angled rather than pure top-down.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Strong 3D extrusion with consistent wall thickness and readable corners; clear floor/wall separation; clean cutaway. Minor simplification/flatness in some wall top edges and limited ceiling/roof detailing.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Core apartment zones generally match (3 bedrooms, central living/dining, kitchen/utility, office). However, exterior spaces from the plan (large deck and balconies) are not represented, and some bathroom/partition placements and proportions appear simplified relative to the 2D plan.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture is present in bedrooms and living/dining; kitchen counters and bathroom fixtures are shown. Placement mostly matches expected rooms with generally reasonable scale; some elements are simplified blocks.

visual_clarity.notes: Clean, readable rendering with distinct walls/floors and good visibility; minimal artifacts. Window/door detailing is simplified and some openings are hard to verify precisely.

detected_errors.description: Exterior areas in the 2D plan (deck and balconies) are largely missing/not modeled as spaces in the 3D render, reducing layout fidelity.
Some internal partition/bathroom geometry appears simplified and may not precisely match the 2D plan’s exact wall runs and proportions.
Door/window positions and sizes are present but not fully verifiable against the 2D plan due to simplified openings and limited detail.

summary: A true cutaway 3D conversion with solid volumetric walls and readable interiors, but with notable layout-fidelity loss from missing deck/balconies and some simplified internal partitions.
